title: The A.I. Boom Has Found Another Gear. Why Can’t People Shake Their Worries?
summary: It is a time of superlatives in the tech industry, with historic profits, stock prices and deal prices. It’s enough to make some people very nervous.

title: Stocks Tumble as Early Rally Gives Way to Tech Anxiety
summary: After a week of market uneasiness, Nvidia’s profit surge and Walmart’s earnings had initially offered investors relief. But the bullishness faded by Thursday afternoon.

title: Job Gains Disguise Weakness Beyond Service Industries
summary: The unemployment rate rose in September as more people looked for jobs, according to data delayed by the government shutdown.

title: U.S. Manufacturers to Benefit as GE Appliances Shifts Production
summary: The company, now owned by a Chinese conglomerate, is investing $150 million in 19 American suppliers across 10 states.

title: Trump Calling Reporter ‘Piggy’ Was ‘Frankness,’ White House Says
summary: Karoline Leavitt, the White House press secretary, addressed for the first time a schoolyard insult that President Trump lobbed at a Bloomberg News reporter last week.

title: Coast Guard Softens Stance on Hate and Hazing
summary: A new servicewide policy recasts swastikas and nooses as merely “politically divisive” and deletes protections for transgender troops.

title: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Channels Harsh Trump Tone
summary: Pete Hoekstra’s bluntness is seen as undiplomatic by Canadian officials and interpreted as a way for the Trump administration to turn up the heat as trade talks drag on.

title: U.S. Ran a War Game on Ousting Maduro. Venezuela Fell Into Chaos.
summary: An official U.S. government exercise during President Trump’s first term forecast turmoil and potential violence in a post-Maduro Venezuela.

title: Democrats Raise Concerns Over Allied Curbs on Intelligence Sharing
summary: Britain’s limits on sharing information reflect growing unease among partner nations over the legality of the U.S. strikes on boats purportedly carrying drugs.

title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump From Deploying National Guard in D.C.
summary: Judge Jia M. Cobb found that the presence of more than 2,000 National Guard troops, many from outside D.C., was most likely unlawful. She paused the order from taking effect until Dec. 11.

title: Officials Move to Drop Case Against Drivers in Chicago Immigration Clash
summary: Two motorists had been charged with crimes in connection to an incident in Chicago in October. Federal authorities had shot and injured one of the drivers.

title: Appeals Court Blocks Release of Hundreds of Chicago-Area Immigration Detainees
summary: The order temporarily halts a federal judge’s call to release several hundred people arrested during the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown in Illinois.

title: Homeland Security Says Border Patrol Operation in Charlotte Is Not Over
summary: The mayor and sheriff said earlier in the day that the operation appeared to have concluded. But a homeland security spokeswoman said that the effort was “not ending anytime soon.”

title: Cheney Remembered for Transforming National Security and Standing Against Trump
summary: As the former vice president was honored at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday, many eyes were focused on who came — and who did not.

title: Short on Cash, D.N.C. Took Out $15 Million Loan in October
summary: The move, unusual for a year without a midterm or presidential election, is the latest sign of financial distress for the Democratic Party.

title: Mamdani Urges D.S.A. Not to Endorse a Challenger to Jeffries
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani argued that an endorsement of a left-leaning ally, Chi Ossé, would hurt his efforts to secure mainstream Democratic support for his proposals.

title: Trump Elevates Once-Fringe Meme Makers to the Mainstream

summary: Some in Kyiv expressed confusion over the Trump administration’s multiple diplomatic tracks as Washington tries to revive negotiations.

title: Miss Hall’s Students Accused a Teacher of Sexual Abuse, But Prosecutors Won’t Charge Him
summary: Despite evidence of sexual abuse by a Massachusetts teacher, prosecutors said no criminal conduct occurred. Now survivors are trying to change consent laws they say “offered cover” to their abuser.

title: Family Affair: Commerce Secretary’s Sons Cash In on A.I. Frenzy
summary: Howard Lutnick is helping push data center projects. His family companies are profiting from them.

summary: The outcome of the sale could alter the trajectory of the entertainment business.

title: After the Louvre Heist, the Museum’s President Defends Her Tenure
summary: In one of her very few interviews since the museum heist, Laurence des Cars said the plan would increase much-needed security, but critics say it is too focused on new construction.

title: After 167 Years in New York, a Priceless Coin Collection Heads to Toledo
summary: The doubloons, dollars and denarii of the American Numismatic Society will leave their overlooked home in Manhattan for a more welcoming headquarters on the campus of the Toledo Museum of Art.

title: Before Fatal UPS Plane Crash, Engine Brace Had Cracked, Safety Agency Says
summary: The cargo plane was taking off from Louisville earlier this month when it crashed moments after becoming airborne, killing the three crew members and 11 people on the ground.
